title: Yewon Kang
text:
I am a 2nd year PhD student in Educational Psychology at the University of Minnesota.
Reading + Learning Lab

title: About
text: Hi! My name is Yewon Kang. I am a 2nd year PhD student in Educational Psychology at the University of Minnesota. My research focuses on learning, memory, and source credibility.

title: About
text:
Education
🎓 PhD in Educational Psychology, University of Minnesota, Minneapolis, MN (2022 - Present)
Advisor: Panayiota Kendeou
🎓 MA in Education, Yonsei University, Seoul, Republic of Korea (2022)
Advisor: Hee Seung Lee
🎓 BA in Education, Yonsei University, Seoul, Republic of Korea (2020)
👩🏻‍🏫 Elementary Teaching Certificate, Republic of Korea (2018)

Publications
Kang, Y., Ha, H., & Lee, H. S. (2023). When more is not better: Effects of interim testing and feature highlighting in natural category learning. Educational Psychology Review, 35, Article 51.
Kang, Y., & Lee, H. S. (2022). Teachers’ metacognitive awareness and use of empirically-supported teaching strategies. The Korean Journal of Educational Psychology, 36(3), 303-327.
Ha, H., Kim. S., Kang. Y., & Lee, H. S. (2021). Metacognitive awareness and use of effective learning strategies in concept and category learning. The Korean Journal of Educational Psychology, 35(1), 1-25.
